channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping, 8th September
item.description:
This fly tipped rubbish has been here for over a week stuff keeps getting added to please remove ASAP as rats have been seen there thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chilver Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned fiat, 8th September
item.description:
This car has been abandoned here for a very very long time. It was once a nice car but I don’t think it could ever move again. There is now more pressure for parking on the street and more junk piling up around the car. It would be nice to have it moved away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Ferris Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Carpet dumped next to bike hanger, 8th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Ferris Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Street Light still out on Hugh Street, 8th September
item.description:
The light outside number 37 Hugh Street has not been working for about 3 weeks, I already reported it on the 3rd September but it seems the case has been closed. The light is still not working and the street is very dark
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Hugh Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in the pavement caused by a missing bollard, 8th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Hill, London

item.title: Flags outside school entrance, 8th September
item.description:
There are England flags up the hill and into Bexley and right outside the hall. Setting aside this is public street furniture and we can’t all decorate how we want, outside the entrance to the school which is a diverse school representing a diverse community, is not appropriate or acceptable. If the others stay up then so be it, but above a school entrance with children of all backgrounds entering causes tension and is not representative of the environment
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
